website_summaries.verdict: For those who don't mind an element of surprise, the 4M Water Rocket Kit can launch a standard two-liter soda bottle at least 100 feet in the air. Works with most bicycle pumps, but an adapter may be necessary.
pros: Works with either a specialized water rocket or soda bottles
Launches are unpredictable, which adds excitement
Can be modified with an air compressor for maximum height
cons: Requires a smaller Presta air pump or adapter, not a standard bike pump
Some consumers report not receiving the pump

customer_reviews.title: We emptied the playground!
customer_reviews.text: Great fun my son loves it. When the kids saw it on the soccer field the playground emptied out and all the kids came to watch and launch the rocket.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob J

customer_reviews.title: It's a blast
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pretty awesome for what it is. (A pop bottle with a few plastic thingers.) I imagine you could make it yourself easy enough, but for the price it's not worth the hassle of spending an hour at Lowe's figuring out what fits together. For extra velocity, we tapped the bung in the bunghole (ha ha) with a hammer. Check out the video.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Fun fun fun
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh, so much fun! Works as intended. We put it together in seconds and grandkids love it! It pops off really high so careful where you pop it off, I would go to an open area. I bought them some glow in the dark bracelets and necklaces to play with and one of the kids got the bright idea to put them in the bottle rocket. It was really fun to watch the glowing rocket blast off at night. Good purchase for the price, well worth the fun.
customer_reviews.author: JEFF JACKSON

customer_reviews.title: This rocket is awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and use, but you must have your own air pump. Everything else is included. We used a bicycle air pump. You attach the tail fin assembly to the two-liter bottle (included) then push the stopper with an air line into the bottom of the rocket. You stand the rocket on a hard surface, then pump air into the rocket. Eventually the built-up pressure pushes the stopper out and the rocket blasts off. The harder you push the stopper in, the higher the rocket goes. By really forcing the stopper in, we were able to fly to well over 100 feet. This is the best water rocket I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: maddogdad

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Introductory Kit for Rocketry
customer_reviews.text: Fist off, you must level set your expectations with this kit. This will not orbit the earth but will hit about 50 to 80 Feet. The kit is a perfect intro into rocketry that is safe and fun for younger kids. We used it with a 3 and 4 year old. This is easy to set up and launch. It took us 3 minutes from unboxing to launch, and launch it did. The only note i have is to make sure to insert the plug as tightly as you can with out crushing the bottle and start pumping. We loved it so much we plan to buy more to give as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Alain

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be better
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun water rocket. I would have rated higher but after many attempts with the recycled bottle I just wasn't satifyed with the height it was doing and it failed a few times and went only few feet in air. The reason why I still rate high though is because I switched to a 2 liter bottle and it went 200+ feet in air everytime. I also didn't have a bike pump so I tried a ball pump and that wasn't working so I switched to my air compressor and it worked out great. My kids, niece and nephew had a blast doing this and even had some neighbors join in on the fun.
customer_reviews.author: Sam & Cheree

customer_reviews.title: Great Inexpensive Toy or Gift!
customer_reviews.text: Great toy & gift for an 8 yr old boy! Out of all the expensive toys he got for Christmas, this one was surely a huge hit. I would guess this would be suitable for ages 5-12, but as I write this, my 43 year old husband had just as much fun as his son! Very easy to use. Would suggest parental assistance for the younger ones, but once my 8 yr old son was shown how it works, he can operate it on his own. Just watch out that it doesn’t get stuck in the trees.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the best science thing that this company makes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and we have used it multiple years in a row. It goes way higher than you would expect it would. It's a great system and it's reusable which is great. After we had so much fun with this I looked through everything that this company makes on amazon and this is the best. We did the hovercraft one too, but that was basically a "dad build it" sort of thing. This is really great. You need to bring your own bike pump though FYI
customer_reviews.author: MHbus

customer_reviews.title: Cake Rocket
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help me with a GISH item to launch a 3-tier cake 6ft. While it didn't make it that high, I did get an impressive lift of about a 1ft after I glued the fins on. So, there is an impressive amount of power to this. \m/ Please do note that my mini bike pump did NOT fit the included nozzles, which caused to the tubbing to bust free and the pressurized water to spray my in the face on the first test run, so you definitely need a full-sized, "classic" bike pump.
customer_reviews.author: Dark Siren

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Water Rocket to entertain my grandkids (ages 7-16) on Easter. It was extremely fun for them to watch as their uncles launched it into space. It went up almost out of sight and came down very close (within 25 feet) of the "launch site" on the street in front of our house. This toy kept everyone excited and laughing--kids and adults alike--for 2 hours!
customer_reviews.author: P.T.

customer_reviews.title: Works really well. Especially if you have compressed air (no hand pump)
customer_reviews.text: This is a very basic system. It looks too simple to work, but it works really really well. You get a 1 liter bottle in the box, but a 2 liter soda bottle is even better as it goes higher and floats down slower. I fill up the bottle about 1/2 way to get the best lift. You get an extra rocket fin too altho I have not needed that yet. I'm thinking I'm getting 100 ft up with a 2 liter bottle. With an air compressor, it takes about 5 seconds of air to get the rocket to launch.
customer_reviews.author: tchite

customer_reviews.title: SO GOOD
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and well made -- the plastic pieces CLICK. Detailed, clearly written instructions. It was thoughtful of the manufacturer to include a plastic bottle, and BOTH types of bike pump adapters, and a spare fin in case one breaks. But best of all..... IT REALLY WORKS. Super easy and fun, and you can do it over and over (and over and over...) using just a bike pump and a jug of tap water. Fabulous.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher

customer_reviews.title: So much fun
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my 12 year old brother but man we both had an absolute blast with this thing. It takes like 3 minutes to assemble everything and the rocket gets some serious air. Everyone loved it, but then it veered off course and got stuck in the top of one of our trees :( oh well, hoping we have a strong wind soon that’ll knock it loose. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Brittney Freeman

customer_reviews.title: ... all of the grandkids (and their parents) busy having fun for two hours on the first use
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these and kept all of the grandkids (and their parents) busy having fun for two hours on the first use. We found the best was to fill them below the line - they go just as high but with more water in them, they seem to retain more on the way down and hit the ground harder. I think the instructions say they will go up to 120 feet - the harder you push in the plug the higher they go. I know we had them up over 300 feet and when the wind picked up, they were sailing into the tall trees - we had to keep moving the launching pad. Great fun for the kids!
customer_reviews.author: S. BOWEN

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!!
customer_reviews.text: This toy is so much fun and super easy to use. I have boys - ages 9&10 and they were both easily able to pump the rocket and it only takes 2-3 pumps before it blasts off. It does go high and the wind will carry it away if you aren't careful! Definitely pick a wide open space! My kids loved blasting it off and chasing it as it came down to land. We just kept a jug of water handy for refills. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: guardinanangel

customer_reviews.title: Works well, kid loved it
customer_reviews.text: So, a lesson was learned. If you fill this fully with water it will launch maybe five feet. However, if you fill it say, 70% of the way with water and remember that air compresses but liquid does not.... well suffice it to say it shot up about 100ft and flew over two houses on its journey. We had to get out the drone to locate its landing point in in a friendly neighbors backyard... in their upstairs balcony. Sadly their dogs ate it. Overall though great little toy.
customer_reviews.author: Raechel

customer_reviews.title: Great Fun!!
customer_reviews.text: The kit is pretty simple. It's easy to set up and use. This thing flies over 100 feet in the air. My grand children and the neighbors all loved playing with this. The bottle launches almost out of sight! They had contests to see who could get it to go the highest! It draws a crowd in the park because the kids love to see it go up. Then every one wanted a turn. Just need a source of water, we used a bucket, to put into the bottle. When you open the kit, it doesn't seem like much, but once you try it you will enjoy the results!
customer_reviews.author: Coug 123

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: My son (3yrs old) and I ran around the area trying to find it after launch. We used a cigarette lighter air pump from my car to pump air into it and my son learned not only about power, but how to operate the air pump and how to connect and launch rocket. So awesome, much better than the stomp rocket!!! We love it!!
customer_reviews.author: William W.

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how high this thing goes! It survived an enormous flight up with only 2 pushes on the bike pump. I was also surprised how sturdy it was and that we could launch it over and over again a dozen times. My grandson loved it and now we have to buy more. Great project to teach kids physics.
customer_reviews.author: Sherylncs

customer_reviews.title: 3, 2, 1 Blast off!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 6th Grade Science Co-Op. The group loved taking turns launching! I've attached a slo-mo video. The only drawback to this design is that the water starts to backfill into the pump because of the great amount of pressure before it launches, so make sure you leave all the hoses unattached to dry out before you store or use your pump for it's intended use! Lots of fun on a sunny day! This also works with any plastic bottle with the traditional soda-sized mouth.
customer_reviews.author: abracadabra

customer_reviews.title: Good for kids
customer_reviews.text: Good for play and experiments with water bottle rockets. The key is consistent force inserting the stopper and the number of pumps. The material deficiency is the tube connection to the stopper and pump. You may need an adhesive.
customer_reviews.author: JtotheR

customer_reviews.title: Educational and fun!  Flies High!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect unique gift for a birthday party. We didn't want just another toy, but something unique and educational. This flies HIGH! With the big push in schools for STEM this is a great gift. You can experiment with different amounts of water and pressure. Other options would be decorating the bottle and assessing how that effects the flight. The great thing about this is that it can be used again and again. The only drawback is that the fins actually attach to the bottle, so if the bottle were to be lost you'd need new fins. Please note that you do need an air pump such as a bicycle pump to go with this.
customer_reviews.author: CarlyandDylan

customer_reviews.title: wow, I am impressed.
customer_reviews.text: my daughter an I used this for her second grade science fair project. her hypothesis was that viscosity would alter the acceleration of the bottle. I laughed not thinking anything about how this might actually work. we hooked the inlet line to a 300 gallon air compressor and filled the bottle full of cooking oil. the rocket flew up about 175 feet- this thing isn't a joke. we had a sideways launch using alcohol and the bottle flew about 250 yards at a 30 degree incline. super fun item.
customer_reviews.author: sillyghillie

customer_reviews.title: This thing works great, and the construction quality seems good
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great, and the construction quality seems good. I do wish there was a more "theatrical" version, where you could see the water streaming out the back for a second or so, like the one I had as a kid. That would give more a sense of how the physics worked. With this one, the nozzle is a big enough, that all the water dumps out in the blink of an eye. That probably gives the greatest height, but a smaller diameter nozzle would be more entertaining, watching the thing climb on a column of water. In fact, the small-diameter-nozzle is an screw-on attachment any of these vendors could make. Somebody do it!
customer_reviews.author: Nick Parlante

customer_reviews.title: So much fun
customer_reviews.text: I'm a scientist and love to surprise my grandsons (10,8,4) when they are done with school for the day. I meet them at the bus with a bag full of experiments for them to do. This is one of the simplest but also one of the most requested. They ask me to do it again and again. It is super simple and LOTS of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick A. Mead

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: A gift for my 5 year old grandson. He can assemble and operate this all on his own. Goes up very high, IMO. All the kids at the birthday party loved this toy. We must have launched this thing 15 times in less than an hour. So much easier, faster, and cheaper to use than the "real" toy rockets that use solid fuel engines.
customer_reviews.author: Lilsdad

customer_reviews.title: So fun! Perfect for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome!! Got it for my nephew for Christmas. We probably spent a little over an hour outside launching it. The best part, it doesn’t matter how strong 💪 you are... this thing will launch high every time. The trick is to make sure the stopper cap on the bottle is pressed in well. The more pressure it has to build, the higher it will go... and man, it goes high! Perfect gift for anyone, any age! :)
customer_reviews.author: Candace Dill

customer_reviews.title: Hours of Fun
customer_reviews.text: This super simple, easy to assemble rocket packs a powerful launch. It works with most standard PET bottles which is good in case your launch ends up off target (as my neighbour's roof will attest). As the literature suggests, experiment with varying amounts of water and aim for the sky.
customer_reviews.author: Dianna Prince

customer_reviews.title: Great for the little scientist in your house
customer_reviews.text: We have bought this rocket twice. We bought it for our youngest to use as an introduction to the 4-H aerospace project, and then we bought another to give to her cousin because we knew he'd have fun with it as well. We've used this at several public events (ex. 4th of July) and they gather large numbers of kids curious about how the rocket works. It's a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.author: elanorh

customer_reviews.title: Best $20 I've ever spent for the kids
customer_reviews.text: My kids (and every kid in the neighborhood) love this, little ones might need help with pumping. We found that if you fill the included bottle approximately 1/3 with water (slightly higher than the instructions say) you get maximum height. Durable, can be used with any bottle with standard soda bottle threads.
customer_reviews.author: C Kole Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Kids absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together. An extra fin is included which is great. The included bottle is very durable and a nice thicker walled bottle than a normal soda bottle. My kids and I had a ton of fun playing with this. I think we shot it off probably 30 times the first day. So much fun experimenting with different amounts of water. Kids are excited to try different bottles as well. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Kludolph

customer_reviews.title: Looking for a water rocket? Get this one.
customer_reviews.text: If you’re gonna get a water rocket, this is the one to get. It goes real high. Easily 150 feet or so. The kids love it. People come from across the park to check it out. Easy to assemble, easy to use. You’ll need a bike pump (not included). You might wanna get two kits, ‘cuz the rockets go so high you might lose ‘em (like we did). Losing rockets ‘cuz they go so high? That’s a good problem to have.
customer_reviews.author: Barney Greinke

customer_reviews.title: Ton infinity and beyond
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old son and I have been having a blast with this. very simple design, a minute to assemble and just add water and an air pump. We personally like to use a hand bike tire pump, it gives you more control and my son loves pumping it. Fill to the indicated line, I tried more and less but the recommended amount is just right. This launches by the internal pressure forcing the plug out and forcing out the water and compressed air. The description says 30 feet, I would say we have been over 75 feet high. Fun for kids and adults! Recommended to all!
customer_reviews.author: Traveling Man77

customer_reviews.title: Really easy to assemble and use
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I did not expect much from it but it keeps my 5 and 1yo entertained for hours. We put food coloring in the water in ours to change it up. Shots really high and the kids love running to get it and then filling it back up.
customer_reviews.author: Zane Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great kit; lots of cheap thrills for kids from 3-93!!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic system and costs virtually nothing to launch, so you can launch over and over. We cut the top off a comparable bottle and taped to the base of the bottle for better aerodynamics. I had a compressed air tank and a rubber-tipped airgun which worked perfectly. Beware that the rocket will hang in tree branches. Great fun for a wide age group.
customer_reviews.author: Vic H - Nashville

customer_reviews.title: Not just for kids!
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived quickly and in prefect condition. Having a blast with the grandkids. Neighbor was watching and said he was going home to order one for his grandkids. Great product, lots of fun. Great fun to cost ratio!
customer_reviews.author: Billy Bob

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nephew’s birthday and had fun launching it a few times with him. But he’s 4, so he had to do it himself, which was a little anticlimactic. I bought another for my friend’s kids and had a blast (see what I did there). We launched it above the trees probably 20 times before we were all too cold and went inside. Highly recommended, especially if you use an electric (low psi) compressor
customer_reviews.author: A. Milefsky

customer_reviews.title: Best cheap (educational) toy we've ever purchased - easily hitting 100 feet up every time.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely FANTASTIC! Great value for money, reusable and surprisingly durable. It's a huge hit in our household - it's somewhat difficult to tell exactly how high it goes, easily over 100 feet. To say that it has exceeded our expectations would be a huge understatement. Best toy ever and with a very slight STEM/educational aspect to it. This would make an excellent birthday present for either a boy or a girl between 10-15 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Rob C

customer_reviews.title: Big Air!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my godson. He and my best friend LOVED it! Setup was straightforward. The rocket shot so far up into the air, it was hard to see for a few seconds. The best part is that you cam get multiple uses out of it. Don't forget to have a bike pump for lift off!
customer_reviews.author: jumbo shrimp

customer_reviews.title: What a blast!
customer_reviews.text: Used this over and over. Gave as a gift for a 7 year old, but the older kids love it too. We used it at a park, so it lands on the grass. No problems with it at all. The best part is that it uses water so no need to deal with vinegar and baking soda.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Love it - Super easy and great teaching tool
customer_reviews.text: I read an article of top 10 things dads need to do with their kids -- and building a bottle rocket was one of them. Buying all the pieces at Home Depot may save you a few bucks, but its nice to just get everything delivered in a simple package via Amazon. Great science teaching tool -- super easy to assemble, and this thing goes pretty darn high and straight. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: My Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Flies up pretty far! Lots of fun for the kids!
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty cool water rocket. I was used to one where you stomp on a pad really hard that gives the rocket pressure to launch. This water rocket requires a bicycle pump, which is not included, to build pressure. My kids are still a little too young to push the pump down as hard as you need to to build the pressure, but they love running after it when it launches. The harder you push the plug in the bottle the more pressure you get in there to make it launch higher! Definitely a fun toy for the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Better that I expected!
customer_reviews.text: We got this as an Easter present for our girls ages 6 and 8. They really like little experiments and so I thought this would be a fun little gift. I was shocked by how much they liked it! I love that it is reusable. They spent hours shooting it off and laughed the entire time. I was also really impressed with how high it goes. So much higher than I expected. I guess you could say this rocket exceeded my expectations in every way. Go ahead and get one. You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: BattFam

customer_reviews.title: Great rocket, works well
customer_reviews.text: Great rocket, works well, easy to setup and very fun! Pump adapter broke an hour after it was opened. 5 times and that was it. I just read where other people had the same issue. It's a small plastic adapter. Change manufactures or send multiple adapters!
customer_reviews.author: T.Tech

customer_reviews.title: Wroks great and lots of fun for the family.
customer_reviews.text: Yes, the kit itself is very basic if you consider materials vs. price. But be honest, you are not going to source this out yourself. It is tremendous fun with the kids and all the family, really surprises everyone with with how fast and high it goes. Just remind everyone not to pump it when someone is standing too close to the "rocket", this thing goes... It does not come with a pump so make sure you have one, it does come with 2 adapters for different kind of valves.
customer_reviews.author: IR

customer_reviews.title: this is a toy that really delivers!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this kit for our grandson for Christmas. We were on a very limited budget and this looked good. Unlike a lot of kits/toys, this one was a winner right out of the box. Bottle is included, and this one really moves. If you are looking for something that really works and will entertain, this kit is the one!
customer_reviews.author: M. Bellows

customer_reviews.title: Un science toy
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for some science based toys to play with my 11 year old granddaughter. She had great fun with this. It shoots about 90 feet in the air. The hardest part was hauling all the water for relaunches. Just be aware you need to supply your own bicycle pump, and you will need quite a bit of space.
customer_reviews.author: Steven and Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Water Rocket Kit
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my 12 yr old grandson and my 8 yr old grandson. They had fun putting together the rockets. The directions were clear and easy to understand.
customer_reviews.author: Karen R

customer_reviews.title: It flies high!
customer_reviews.text: This thing exceeded all my expectations and the kids (9 - 14 years old) absolutely love it. I would estimate it flies as high as 200 feet in the air. It's easy to assemble, the parts are good quality, and it can be used with common plastic bottles. We've used it several times for great amusement!
customer_reviews.author: DDIP

customer_reviews.title: Great for all ages
customer_reviews.text: I don't know who has more fun the adults or the kids... we experimented with various bottles and a 20 ounce pop bottle is so far the best. Varied the level of water as an experiment to find better launches... hours of fun
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Murray

customer_reviews.title: Great project for boys and girls
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my nine year old son. We followed the instructions, and took it outside to test it out. Just like the instructions said, within just a few pumps, it blasted into the sky, much higher than we expected. We live in the city, so we have to be careful to use this in a park where there is plenty of room. I'm glad this worked, and think it would make a great gift for boys or girls around ages 8-12. They may need a little help putting it together, but once it's set up, you only have to add water to the bottle each time before launching.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Replacement parts should be easier to find.
customer_reviews.text: Broke too quickly, was unable to find replacement parts so I had to buy it all again. Otherwise great product. Comes with replacement find, but it was the adapter they fit on that split.
customer_reviews.author: Patrice Dunn

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a BLAST...made it very easy to have fun.
customer_reviews.text: OMG, this thing was SOOO much fun. We all had a BLAST. I can't believe how high this thing went. Then, we change it to a 2 liter bottle..OMG. I bet this thing goes 150 to 200 feet in the air...quite impressive! Durable fins. We used a compressor and the kids launched this thing and chase it coming down for hours...cant wait till summer, we did it in winter!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Catnip

customer_reviews.title: Our students LOVE this!
customer_reviews.text: This is actually our second one. Our first was well loved. It lasted longer than I thought. Make sure to use on soft landing area. The parking lot was eventually the demise of the first one. That said, it lasted through many launchings!
customer_reviews.author: Mary E. Kingsley

customer_reviews.title: Fun for kids
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old loves this. It works with any bicycle pump. The standing one is just better for him because it takes a little strength to shoot it up. It shoots super high up so don’t do this in your yard
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gift  - Totally cool and fun - Hours of fun!
customer_reviews.text: I can't even tell you how well this worked but I will try. It works great and keeps my guys entertained for hours. They have used it several days over the course of a few months and experimented with water level and temperature. They discovered that hot water makes it go higher and on a cool day high enough to almost lose the visual. I was worried it would break after a few uses so I made them take turns and after about an hour I wasn't worried anymore. The fins not only help keep it straight going up but help slow down the fall.
customer_reviews.author: rekab

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for the whole family!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this kit for a gift for some friends. After testing it out with them, we had to get one for our kiddos too. It was a huge hit! It just takes water and a bike pump. I highly recommend getting the parachute that is optional if you have small children. Otherwise it could come crashing down on their heads! Also, use a wide open space. We thought we picked a good, wide open space, but still had it get caught in a tree twice. Younger kids (3-6) might need a hand with the air pump to get it to take off (as pictured) but they will still enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Texas Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Fun little product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little toy. We started with the standard setup and it was fun for me and the kids. But for extra velocity and height we filled up the bottle about 1/3 with Coke and attached it to a(also purchased on Amazon and also 5 stars) and the bottle REALLY launched. We experimented with 2 and 3 liter bottles but the best combo was the original bottle with Coke.
customer_reviews.author: Edmund

customer_reviews.title: Kids can't get enough of it.
customer_reviews.text: Relatively safe alternative to solid rockets, and a lot cheaper to launch over and over and over. I found that a small self contained emergency road-side compressor works excellent and we can sit out for hours launching, refilling and launching again and again till the battery in the compressor is drained.
customer_reviews.author: DocO

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: This water rocket is great. It was a hit at my daughters birthday party. All of the kids enjoyed trying to make the rocket go the highest in the air. Water did not splash everywhere and connecting the air pump was simple. We didn't bother using some of the connectors for the hoes and the bike pump. We just put the tube in the pump and closed the latch to the pump.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fun and excellent example of propulsion
customer_reviews.text: I don’t what warmth means. The bottle Provide is thin walled but worked great. Also soda and water bottles worked well also. It takes a good quality bicycle pump and used the adaptors provided in the kit.
customer_reviews.author: Big E

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Fun but was a anniversary gift for my husband but was delivered with no cover on it and he grabbed it from the mail and ruined the surprise.
customer_reviews.author: Gizella Arroyo

customer_reviews.title: Kids and adults will love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6 year old sun this summer. He loves it. I do too. It was interesting to watch him work through the amount of fuel needed to go it's highest. Every time some kids come over we get the rocket out and all kids and adults love it. I does go really really high, and really really fast, so it is possible to launch it to a place where you wouldn't be able to get it. Like a roof or in the top of some trees, so have a nice sized area to launch it. You will love it.
customer_reviews.author: BryanATL

customer_reviews.title: A great gift for small children.
customer_reviews.text: The plastic pump fittings were a bit unreliable, but I wrapped some teflon tape on it and got it to work pretty well. I bought this as a gift for my young nephews to get them interested in physics and make them think about how air pressure and water can propel objects. It shot higher than I expected it to, and it floated down slow enough to where it should have no durability concerns operating in a grassy area. We used it in the street and it scuffed up a bit, but didn't have any disabling problems. It was a rather inexpensive hobby kit at the time, and if the price stays low I recommend it without reservation.
customer_reviews.author: Avenging Taco

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 would buy and recommend
customer_reviews.text: This thing is freaking awesome. My 8 year old and I made a bet about how high it would go. We were both way off. It flew at LEAST 100ft up! It ended up in a tree after the second launch, but that does not take away from it's awesomeness.
customer_reviews.author: Danny J

customer_reviews.title: Very cool product and assembled very easy
customer_reviews.text: Very cool product and assembled very easy. My 3 year old was doing it with no problem. But the problem is cheap plastic. It last maybe 12 launches and just from it landing broke where one of the fins go in. That's the reason for the 2 stars.. product needs to be made of stronger plastic. They are ripping their customers off.
customer_reviews.author: Ian W

customer_reviews.title: Wow, very impressed.
customer_reviews.text: I was really really surprised at this toy. Even though I read the reviews, I could not believe how high this thing flies when you pump it full of air. I got this for my 7 year old for Christmas and we got lucky with very mild weather so we tried it out. My 2 boys absolutely loved it and got a kick out of how high the thing would fly. It's a little tricky (and probably not recommended) for a kid to operate this on their own, but they can definitely pump it on their own. Great, great toy that will be fun in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Rizzle2d

customer_reviews.title: Fun!!!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to assemble. Ordered 2 sets. One for my children and one for my nieces. However one of the fins did break upon landing-
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne Gray

customer_reviews.title: SOOOO much fun! Although not recommend to hook up to an ...
customer_reviews.text: SOOOO much fun! Although not recommend to hook up to an air compressor..lol, or if you do make sure you set it low! we ended up losing it in a tree somewhere for over 2 weeks waiting for some wind and rain to knock it down since we had No idea where it had for sure gone! Find the sweet spot for filling with water and this thing goes soaring! over 50ft!
customer_reviews.author: momof3

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: Took my grandkids out and had loads of fun with this, just need bike pump and water, you can use 2 ltr plastic bottles, kids loved it couldn't believe how high and fast it traveled. Worth the purchase price.
customer_reviews.author: James Gardiner

customer_reviews.title: Science Fun!
customer_reviews.text: The rocket was easy to put together and launch. I would recommend bringing a couple of 3 liter bottles along with just water so can launch again quickly.
customer_reviews.author: James W.

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a wow factor with the kids. 5 yr old boy can just barely pump it enough to make it go off (12 pumps or so) while I can easily get it quickly. Either way, it flies higher than the 3'-wide pine trees nearby. Other bottles work too, and water height varies the optimum height, so play around with it. Came with some spare parts just in case, but nothing has broke after 6 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Used this today with my kids and their friends. Ages 3-8. They had a blast. The bicycle pump def takes some muscle. Harder for the younger kids. But with some help from an adult they thought it was cool to learn about pressure!!!
customer_reviews.author: Marin

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value, impressive performance.
customer_reviews.text: I was so skeptical at first, but so impressed when we used it. Sparked great conversation about water vs air ratios and why it works in the first place. See pictures.
customer_reviews.author: C. Koberg

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly durable
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised with this. It launches REALLY high and doesn’t even break when it lands. We used it over a dozen times today and look forward to much more play.
customer_reviews.author: J. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap fun!
customer_reviews.text: These are a blast. My son and I have tons of fun with this. Second kit, as the fins break when landing on hard objects like concrete roofs etc. Good cheap fun and he is learning lots.
customer_reviews.author: km

customer_reviews.title: this thing is a lot of fun, kids will love it
customer_reviews.text: well made, easy to use (you do need an air pump)... we used an electric air pump... shoots 2 litre bottles over 100 feet in the air... fill bottle about 1/3 full of water, it'll shoot a lot farther up than you think.
customer_reviews.author: Christiana

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for the young kids
customer_reviews.text: Rediculously overpriced for an empty bottle, plastic bits, and tubing, but great fun for the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Joe in Woodinville

customer_reviews.title: Trying to get him to enjoy other activities
customer_reviews.text: My nephew is a nine year old, video game or remote control gift only type of kid. Trying to get him to enjoy other activities, I bought this. It was a huge success! He had no issues pumping up the bike pump (which is not included) himself. He played with this rocket for a long time. As a side note, he decided to bring the rocket inside, was smart enough not to put water in it and yes it still flew, hitting the ceiling, thankfully nothing and no one got hurt!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you have a presta valve adapter
customer_reviews.text: What really is a bummer about this rocket is for the amount they are over charging you they can't include a presta valve adapter so you can use a regular bike pump. Without it you can't launch. It is smaller than a normal bike tube or car valve stem. Granted they say you need one but if you never used one before you might think a regular pump could be used. The inclusion of a 50 cent part would save a lot of headaches having to run out and buy one.
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: You need a good tire pump, which is not included..
customer_reviews.text: I used this item at a church activity night and the kids were wild about it. I did use a plastic dish pan to set the rocket in as a hard level place, as we were on a grass area. The only problem was that as it hit the ground, even though it was not a hard surface, one of the tail fins broke off.. I replaced it with the spare and continued sending it up. Super glue will glue the fin back together if you use a paper clip as reinforcement. There needs to be a source to order replacement fins.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Works better than I had expected. Lots of fun for kids and families. Make sure you're over grass, not concrete, or the bottle will split when it falls back down.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: i have found my go to birthday gift
customer_reviews.text: i can't tell you how much fun my 5 and 3 year old have with this rocket. this is a great introduction into rocketry if you aren't ready for an Estes engine yet or just want to have some fun in the park. i couldn't believe how high this thing went! the plastic is not all that strong but it is holding together remarkable well and is showing no signs of failing. the fact that you can use any plastic bottle with this is brilliant. i love anything that incorporates science into play, and this definitely delivers. hands down the best gift my son got for his birthday.
customer_reviews.author: terabma

customer_reviews.title: Gru's Mother would approve
customer_reviews.text: The rocket kit worked great. I cheated and used it with my air compressor at a low pressure, gradually increasing until it was fun. I suggest you paint this orange because as soon as your wife tries it, it will be lost in the trees - maybe that part is specific to me? Anyway good fun and educational. Great WOW factor. If mine doesnt come down will buy another. Needs a compressed air source such as a bicycle pump. Tip - push the stopper in firmly and use about 50/50 air to water mix to get some really impreasive height.
customer_reviews.author: Frank_F

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a fun kit! We did some night stuff using glow sticks and also I used a portable battery pack/air compressor to do this. Gets more air in there faster and gives it a better launch!! It's a blast
customer_reviews.author: Paul H

customer_reviews.title: Great gift idea. Unique and not too expensive at $15. (Don't launch near trees, unless you want to go climb a tree.)
customer_reviews.text: This was the hit of the white elephant we went to. It's a neat little toy for adults and kids alike. It only took around ten minutes for someone to suggest that we go open it and play with it. We followed the instructions and used our automatic air pump from the car to launch the rocket. We didn't get wet when the thing launched, but it did go high enough to get stuck in the very top of the neighbors tree... ;\
customer_reviews.author: Chawpped

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a bicycle pump with this. It’s a good looking pump which we decided to keep although we never used it. Since we have an air compressor we tried it first. Wow!!! Over the moon and outta sight!!! This thing is equally exciting for little toddlers and big grandad toddlers!
customer_reviews.author: GrizzDean

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t expecting much with this, but it actually impressed me!! It goes higher than I thought. Kids love it, it doesn’t get you wet like I thought it would either. Works well with a little 12v air pump, less work haha
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: 14 and 10 year old Boys LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.text: The kids said: It surprisingly goes really high! It doesn't break when you use it a lot. It's fun to shoot your sibling with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ezra A. Peters

customer_reviews.title: Awesome but broke pretty instantly
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this but after using it twice the piece that connects to the bottle broke and couldn’t be used anymore which was a huge disappointment
customer_reviews.author: AllyJ

customer_reviews.title: Awesome - Not worth the price of parts - but who cares
customer_reviews.text: So you're paying $20 for a plastic bottle, plastic fins, a tube, rubber cork, and 2 valves. That's probably $1 in parts. BUT - it doesn't matter because this thing works. My kids loved it - we launched it over 12 times without any problems one afternoon. Tip - I was filling the water level to the wrong mark at first. And the rocket went up about 10 feet - so my initial thought was this toy was junk. Then my kids told me to put less water in, and once we did - BOOM - I think we hit the advertised 30 meters (100 feet!)
customer_reviews.author: FW

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for grandson. Cant judge durability yet since he just got it. But I can day he loves it. So far all successful launches
customer_reviews.author: Tess

customer_reviews.title: Fun exceeds price by a long shot!
customer_reviews.text: Fun exceeds price by a long shot! My 5 year old can't get enough of this rocket. He is strong enough to launch it with a typical bicycle pump and really enjoys trying to determine the perfect water level for maximum flight. He insists on trying to catch the rocket as it returns to the ground, so far he hasn't lost an eye but next time we take this to the park I will insist that he wears goggles or safety glasses. Great toy!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Thorman

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Not recommended in case you considering this for competing in science Olympiad
customer_reviews.author: Nauman Shaikh

customer_reviews.title: Exceeeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: Used for scouting event. It went super high and was easy to use for the kids. Hooked it up to my bicycle pump . Also, it is strong and durable. Comes with extra fin but haven’t had to use it yet . Recommend highly!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea C.

customer_reviews.title: Fun for a day
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun thing for a day. Didn’t last past that. Held the attention of a group of kids for several hours so that’s still a win!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good choice... happy rocketing!
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely going to attract some attention at the playground (or wherever you test it out). The instructions are easy to follow and it's pretty easy to get started. Pretty sturdy stuff as well.
customer_reviews.author: vrveerar

customer_reviews.title: Awesome water rocket!
customer_reviews.text: The kids absolutely love this. It has been a great education tool that also allows for a lot of fun. Changing the bottle size is a nice option with the threading being fairly generic. The only bottle thread I've had no luck with is the tiny Dasani bottles as they have a double thread. I've had it easily hit around 60ft, but you can just seat the rubber stopper a little easier and it will limit its pressure/height.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Water Rocket Kit
customer_reviews.text: I improvised and attached the air line on this kit to my portable compressor, since I didn't have a bike pump that would connect to it. I can use the regulator to increase the line pressure gradually. It seems to blow off about 40-50 psi. The kids love this thing, we blast it again and again!
customer_reviews.author: HondaNut

customer_reviews.title: Funner than those fire powered model rockets.
customer_reviews.text: Most excellent purchase. I bought this for a Webelo scout adventure and they absolutely loved it. it was more durable than expected, comes with a 1 liter size bottle, attachments etc. You can also use larger 2 liter bottle of your own. Much better than regular model rockets because you can reuse it with just water. And the water, and pumping action it up adds a level of fun and suspense.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dog

product_meta.title: 4M 4605 Water Rocket Kit - DIY Science Space Stem Toys Gift for Kids & Teens, Boys & Girls
product_meta.description:
Style:Water Rocket KitBlast off into the heavens with the 4M Water Rocket Kit. The 4M Water Rocket Kit uses the power of water pressure to blast its rocket up to 90 feet in the air. The kit contains all the parts required to transform a recycled soda bottle into a functioning water rocket. This kit is ideal for young science enthusiasts, especially those interested in rocketry and space flight. Detailed instructions for use and care are included. Adult supervision recommended. This kit requires the use of a bicycle pump (not included).

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Construct a rocket that blasts over 30 feet with our 4M Water Rocket Kit. Powered by water and air pressure. Pump and instructions are included. Science in action.
feature_bullets: The 4M Water Rocket Kit uses the power of water pressure to blast its rocket up to 90 feet in the air
The kit contains all the parts required to transform a recycled soda bottle into a functioning water rocket
This kit is ideal for young science enthusiasts, especially those interested in rocketry and space flight
Detailed instructions for use and care are included; Adult supervision recommended
This kit requires the use of a bicycle pump (not included)
Challenge your child's imagination with 4M toys and kits
4M educational toys cover a wide range of educational subjects and include science kits, arts and crafts kits, robotics kits, and more
See how the rocket flies, Blasts over 30 feet
Mechanics kits are innovative, inspiring and full of action
Kit includes all required parts and instructions
Educational kit that demonstrates a science principle
4M offers a wide range of toys and kits to let you build a clock, crochet a placemat, or turn your room into a planetarium all in the name of making learning fun
